purpose: Define the mandatory trust conditions that must be met before the system can execute any operational logic.

identityVerified.description: The system identity file must exist and match expected values.

sealsVerified.description: All phase seals from Phase 0 to Phase 9 must be valid and unmodified.

manifestsVerified.description: All manifests must be present and validated against their associated seals.

integrityConfirmed.description: Integrity readings must indicate no breach or corruption.

heartbeatActive.description: The heartbeat system must be active and returning current timestamps.

telemetryValid.description: All telemetry files must be readable and within age limits defined by system policy.

trustGuarantees.consistency: No module can run unless trust conditions are satisfied.
trustGuarantees.traceability: All trust checks produce an audit entry.
trustGuarantees.immutability: Trust conditions cannot be bypassed or modified at runtime.
trustGuarantees.dependencyChain: All engines depend on validated trust status before execution.

failureActions.onIdentityFailure: Block system startup and write audit entry.
failureActions.onSealFailure: Enter critical mode and prevent all engines from running.
failureActions.onManifestFailure: Prevent engine activation until manifest is repaired.
failureActions.onTelemetryFailure: Enter controlled mode and suspend non-essential engines.

summary.statement: This contract defines how WyneOS establishes trust. All system components rely on these conditions for safe operation.
